author: Barrymore Laurence Scherer
title: Hitting the Right Notes for a Soprano’s Centenary
text: When Birgit Nilsson (1918-2005) died at age 87, she was widely hailed as the greatest Wagnerian soprano of her time. The daughter of a Swedish farmer, Nilsson became for many the supreme Brünnhilde in Wagner’s “Ring,” the supreme Isolde in “Tristan und Isolde.” Her voice presented an unrivaled combination—not only could it soar with apparent...
